revised_title: Genomic Imprinting and Seed Development in Angiosperms
tldr: This article explores the phenomenon of genomic imprinting in endosperm, which affects seed development in crosses between species and different ploidies of the same species. The authors explain how imprinting can provide a coherent explanation for the failure of certain experimental crosses and the prevalence of pseudogamy in apomictic angiosperms. They also discuss the genetic basis of imprinting in endosperm and its implications for understanding the evolution of apomixis.
